intro: Bunchosia discolor, commonly known as the red-veined false heather, is a shrub native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers and dark green, velvety leaves with prominent red veins. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Bunchosia discolor is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
